titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that clothing issued to athletes representing the United States of America should be made in America.
Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that clothing issued to athletes representing the United States of America should be made in America.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that the U.S. Olympic Committee should: (1) consider the economic consequences of its purchasing decisions and its ability to positively contribute to American job creation, especially during a time of high unemployment; and (2) strive to ensure that all of the clothing and equipment purchased for U.S. Olympic athletes is made in America.
